item.title: data assimilation
item.description: Links:: [[notes/prj-eqsim]] Calibrate numerical model using the observed values. Inspiration [[Ylona van Dinther|Ylona van Dinther]], Hans R Künsch, Andreas Fichtner, Ensemble data assimilation for earthquake sequences: probabilistic estimation and forecasting of fault stresses, Geophysical Journal International, Volume 217, Issue 3, June 2019, Pages 1453–1478, doi: 10.

item.title: Dieterich.JGR.1994
item.description: A constitutive law for rate of earthquake production and its application to earthquake clustering Authors: [[notes/James H Dieterich|James H. Dieterich]] Source Notes The essential concept of the analysis is the treatment of a seismically active volume of the Earth as having a population of sources that nucleate successive earthquakes to produce observed seismicity.

item.title: Differential Equations and Linear Algebra
item.description: Metadata Author:: [[notes/Gilbert Strang|Gilbert Strang]] Resources: MIT OCW Notes The calculus you need Video At the end, a useful formula in differential equations is confirmed by the product rule, the derivative of $e^x$, and the fundamental theorem of calculus (4) The key step in scientific computing is improving first order accuracy (forward differences) to second order accuracy (centered differences).

item.title: Field.SRL.2019
item.description: How Physics-Based Earthquake Simulators Might Help Improve Earthquake Forecasts Authors:: Edward H Field Date:: 2019 Source:: [[Seismol. Res. Lett.|SRL]] Abstract Questions have persisted on the usefulness of physics-based [[notes/earthquake simulator|earthquake simulators]] with respect to [[notes/earthquake forecast|forecasting earthquakes]], due mostly to the inevitable assumptions, approximations, and uncertainties.

item.title: Field.SRL.2019
item.description: How Physics-Based [[notes/earthquake simulator|Earthquake Simulator]]s Might Help Improve [[notes/earthquake forecast|Earthquake Forecast]]s Author: Edward H. Field Journal: SRL Opinion Abstract Questions have persisted on the usefulness of physics-based earthquake simulators with respect to forecasting earthquakes, due mostly to the inevitable assumptions, approximations, and uncertainties.

item.title: Jackson-PhilosTransA-2006
item.description: Fatal attraction: living with earthquakes, the growth of villages into megacities, and earthquake vulnerability in the modern world Authors: James Jackson Source: Philosophical Transaction A Abstract The great earthquake belt which stretches from the Mediterranean through the Middle East into Central Asia results from the ongoing collision between the Eurasian plate and the African, Arabian and Indian plates to the south.

item.title: Rate-and-state friction
item.description: Rate-and-state friction is a friction law born from tribology experiments. Established by friction experiments and theory works from [[notes/James H Dieterich|James H.
